usefulItems: large food bag, temperature probe, deep saucepan or deep fat fryer, slotted spoon, paper towel, freezer
title: Best Beer Battered Fish

ingredients.content: 550 g ale, (sparkling) or lager, ice cold
800 g cod fillets (4 fillets, each approx. 200 g)

preparations.content: Place a large food bag in mixing bowl and weigh flour into it. Place bag in freezer for 15 minutes.
Heat oil to 180°C in a deep saucepan or deep fat fryer.
<b>Insert butterfly<b> <b>whisk<b>. Place cold flour and baking powder in mixing bowl then mix <b>10 sec/speed 2<b>.

Add ale and whisk <b>2 min/speed 3<b> until smooth. <b>Remove butterfly<b> <b>whisk<b>. Batter should be used immediately; dip fish fillets into batter then carefully place in hot oil and deep-fry for 8-10 minutes (180°C) until golden and cooked through. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Serve hot; delicious with mushy peas, chips and lashings of vinegar.

hintsAndTricks: Lovely accompanied by minted mushy peas with crème fraîche and tartare sauce.

A windy trip to the British seaside…and a nice, hot, paper-wrapped parcel of steaming hot chips, topped with a big fillet of fish in the crispiest batter, drizzled in vinegar. Now you can create your very own version at home!
